meanings.definition: The quality of being small in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The minacity of the toy car made it perfect for the little child to play with.
meanings.sent2: The minacity of the pebble made it easy to skip across the water.
meanings.sent3: The minacity of the ant trying to move the crumb was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The minacity of the seed held the promise of a mighty oak tree within.
meanings.sent5: The minacity of the snowflake made it seem delicate and precious.

meanings.definition: The state of being minor or insignificant.
meanings.sent1: The minacity of the error in the report was quickly overlooked.
meanings.sent2: The minacity of the decision had little impact on the overall outcome.
meanings.sent3: The minacity of the tiny pebble caused a big commotion among the ants.
meanings.sent4: The minacity of the ripple in the pond seemed to disappear in the vast water.
meanings.sent5: The minacity of the raindrop went unnoticed in the storm.

meanings.definition: The act of minimizing or reducing something.
meanings.sent1: The minacity of the chef's cuts made the dish look more appealing.
meanings.sent2: The minacity of the edits improved the clarity of the document.
meanings.sent3: The minacity of the painter's strokes gave the artwork a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: The minacity of the changes transformed the room into a cozy space.
meanings.sent5: The minacity of the alterations enhanced the overall design of the dress.
